document.docAuthor: Burks, Roger A., Heraty, John M., Dominguez, Chrysalyn & Mottern, Jason L.
document.docTitle: Orasema rikra Burks & Heraty & Dominguez & Mottern 2018, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Complex diversity in a mainly tropical group of ant parasitoids: Revision of the Orasema stramineipes species group (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Eucharitidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Complex diversity in a mainly tropical group of ant parasitoids: Revision of the Orasema stramineipes species group (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Eucharitidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. F2 not longer than F3. Mesoscutal midlobe and mesoscutellum, including axillula, areolate. Mesoscutal midlobe with reddish area anteriorly.

Color: Head and mesosoma green to blue, with reddish or yellowish area on mesoscutal midlobe anteriorly. Pedicel pale brown; anellus pale brown; flagellum brown. Coxae brown dorsally, becoming yellow apically; fore femur mostly brown, tips pale; mid femur yellow to yellowish-brown; hind femur yellow. Fore wing hyaline; venation yellowish brown. Petiole dark green-blue; gaster brown with purple luster.

Head: Head width:head height 1.2; face reticulate; longitudinal groove between eye and torulus absent; eyes bare, inter-ocular distance:eye height 1.2–1.4; malar space:eye height 0.6; supraclypeal area longer than broad, smooth medially and ventrally, weakly sculptured dorsally and laterally; clypeus smooth to weakly sculptured. Flagellum length:head height 1.6; F2 1.7–2.0× as long as broad, 1.0–1.2× as long as F3; following funiculars subequal in width, progressively shorter.

Mesosoma: Mesosoma length:height 1.1–1.3. Mesoscutal midlobe areolate, with minute setae; lateral lobe areolate. Axilla areolate; mesoscutellar disc areolate with coarser sculpture posteriorly; frenal line irregularly foveate; frenum areolate; axillular groove anteriorly absent, broad and foveate posteriorly; axillula areolate. Propodeum with irregular median carina; propodeal disc areolate; callus areolate, with 3–5 setae. Mesepisternum areolate laterally with longitudinal carinae, smooth ventrally, broadly rounded anterior to mid coxa. Upper mesepimeron smooth; lower mesepimeron areolate-reticulate; transepimeral sulcus distinct. Metepisternum laterally smooth to weakly sculptured. Hind coxa 1.9–2.3× as long as broad; hind femur 6.4–6.5× as long as broad. Fore wing 2.5–2.6× as long as broad, 2.8–2.9× as long as mesothorax; stigma with 4 sensilla separated into pairs. Hind wing costal cell with 1 or 2 irregular rows of setae.

Metasoma: Petiole 2.1–2.2× as long as broad, 0.8–0.9× as long as hind coxa, areolate anteriorly, becoming reticulate posteriorly, anterior carina weak. Antecostal sulcus with weak sculpture; acrosternite posteriorly angulate.

Material examined. Holotype :

Etymology. The Quechua word for “arm” or “shoulder,” referring to the distinct antenna.
